definitions.text:
STEDFAST [stead and fast.]
1. Fast fixed; firm; firmly fixed or established; the STEDFAST globe of earth.
2. Constant; firm; resolute; not fickle or wavering.
Abide STEDFAST to thy neighbor in the time of his trouble.
Whom resist stedfast in the faith. 1 Peter 5:9.
3. Steady; STEDFAST sight.
